[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Encoding] [Negative Decimal Edge] Can push_decimal with neg=true and value=u128::MAX represent the minimum possible decimal, or does two's complement fail? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Vector] [Reverse Mutation Safety] Does vector::reverse() properly handle mutable references without causing memory corruption in the Hasher buffer? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Vector] [Append Performance] Can repeated append() calls cause quadratic time complexity in message construction, enabling DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Vector] [Memory Allocation] Can extremely large messages cause memory allocation failures or VM resource limits to be exceeded? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Vector] [Push Back Failure] Can push_back() on the buffer fail if the vector reaches maximum capacity, causing transaction abortion? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Cryptography] [SHA2-256 Collision] While SHA2-256 is collision-resistant, can structured message formatting create exploitable collision opportunities? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Cryptography] [Message Padding] Does SHA2-256 padding in hash::sha2_256() match off-chain oracle implementations, or could padding differences cause verification failures? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Cryptography] [Length Extension Attack] Can an attacker use length extension attacks on SHA2-256 to forge valid message hashes without knowing the original message? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Cryptography] [Signature Malleability] Can attackers create multiple valid signatures for the same message by manipulating the hash construction process? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [BCS] [Encoding Consistency] Can BCS encoding format differences between Sui versions cause previously valid oracle signatures to become invalid? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [BCS] [Type Safety] Does bcs::to_bytes() guarantee deterministic encoding for all integer types, or could platform differences cause hash mismatches? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [BCS] [Serialization Overhead] Can extremely large u128 values cause BCS encoding to become computationally expensive, enabling DoS? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Decimal] [Unpack Validation] Does decimal::unpack() perform sufficient validation, or can it return invalid (value, neg) pairs that corrupt hash calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Decimal] [Precision Loss] Can decimal unpacking lose precision for very large or very small values, causing price hash mismatches? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Decimal] [Negative Zero Handling] Does the decimal module treat negative zero differently from positive zero, causing hash inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Decimal] [Mantissa Overflow] Can decimal values with very large mantissas cause overflow when unpacked to u128? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Queue Key All Zeros] Can an attacker pass a 32-byte queue_key of all zeros to bypass queue-specific authorization? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Feed Hash Duplication] Can duplicate feed_hash values across different queues cause cross-queue signature replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Max Variance Zero] Can max_variance=0 be used to force exact price matches, causing all oracle updates to fail and DoS the price feed? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Min Responses Excessive] Can setting min_responses to a very high value (e.g., u32::MAX) make it impossible to get oracle consensus, permanently stalling price updates? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Timestamp Zero] Can timestamp=0 be used to create timeless oracle updates that never expire, bypassing staleness checks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Oracle Key Reuse] Can the same oracle_key be registered in multiple queues, causing authorization confusion in attestation verification? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [MR Enclave All Ones] Can passing an mr_enclave of all 0xFF bytes bypass SGX enclave verification, allowing non-SGX oracles? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Validation] [Secp256k1 Invalid Key] Can the 64-byte secp256k1_key contain an invalid elliptic curve point that still passes length validation but fails signature verification? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Struct] [Drop Ability Safety] Since Hasher has 'drop' ability, can partially constructed messages be silently dropped without finalization, causing missing signatures? (Medium)
